study.name: XYZ-ONCO-2025-001
study.description: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Compound-X in Combination with Standard of Care Chemotherapy in Subjects with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
study.label: Phase III NSCLC Study

studyDesigns.name: DESIGN_1
studyDesigns.label: Phase III NSCLC Study Design
studyDesigns.description: Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel group design evaluating Compound-X plus SoC vs Placebo plus SoC in advanced NSCLC

encounters.name: TRT_C1D1
encounters.label: Treatment Cycle 1 Day 1
encounters.description: First treatment cycle, Day 1 (randomization and first dose)

encounters.name: FU_V1
encounters.label: Safety Follow-up Visit
encounters.description: Safety follow-up visit (30 days post last dose)

activities.name: Vital Signs
activities.label: Vital Signs
activities.description: Measure vital signs including blood pressure, heart rate, temperature, respiratory rate

activities.name: Laboratory Tests
activities.label: Laboratory Tests
activities.description: Perform hematology, chemistry, and urinalysis panels

activities.name: Tumor Assessment
activities.label: Tumor Assessment
activities.description: Perform tumor assessment per RECIST v1.1 criteria

activities.name: Study Drug Administration
activities.label: Study Drug Administration
activities.description: Administer study drug (Compound-X or Placebo) and standard of care chemotherapy

activities.name: Adverse Event Assessment
activities.label: Adverse Event Assessment
activities.description: Evaluate and record adverse events using CTCAE v5.0

activities.name: Survival Follow-up
activities.label: Survival Follow-up
activities.description: Assess overall survival status every 12 weeks after end of treatment

arms.name: COMPX_SOC
arms.label: Compound-X + SoC
arms.description: Compound-X in combination with standard of care platinum-based doublet chemotherapy

arms.name: PBO_SOC
arms.label: Placebo + SoC
arms.description: Matching placebo in combination with standard of care platinum-based doublet chemotherapy

studyDesigns.rationale: Randomized controlled design selected to provide robust efficacy and safety evidence for regulatory submission

epochs.name: SCREENING
epochs.label: Screening
epochs.description: Screening period (up to 28 days before randomization)

epochs.name: RUN_IN
epochs.label: Run-in
epochs.description: Run-in period (7 days prior to randomization)

epochs.name: TREATMENT
epochs.label: Treatment
epochs.description: Active treatment period with 21-day cycles until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

epochs.name: FOLLOW_UP
epochs.label: Follow-up
epochs.description: Safety and survival follow-up period (30 days post last dose and every 12 weeks thereafter)

elements.name: EL_RUNIN
elements.label: Run-in
elements.description: Run-in period to confirm baseline stability

transitionEndRule.name: TR_RUNIN_END
transitionEndRule.text: Baseline assessments completed and eligibility confirmed

elements.name: EL_ACTIVE_TRT
elements.label: Active Treatment
elements.description: Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy (21-day cycles)

transitionEndRule.name: TR_ACTIVE_END
transitionEndRule.text: Disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal of consent

elements.name: EL_PLACEBO_TRT
elements.label: Placebo Treatment
elements.description: Matching placebo in combination with standard of care chemotherapy (21-day cycles)

transitionEndRule.name: TR_PLACEBO_END
transitionEndRule.text: Disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal of consent

elements.name: EL_SAFETY_FU
elements.label: Safety Follow-up
elements.description: Safety follow-up period for adverse event monitoring and survival assessment

transitionEndRule.name: TR_FU_END
transitionEndRule.text: Death, loss to follow-up, or study completion

indications.name: NSCLC
indications.label: Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
indications.description: Advanced non-small cell lung cancer (Stage IIIB/IV)

objectives.name: OBJ_PFS
objectives.label: Primary PFS Objective
objectives.text: To compare the progression-free survival (PFS) of Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy versus placebo in combination with standard of care chemotherapy in subjects with advanced NSCLC.

endpoints.name: EP_PFS
endpoints.label: PFS Endpoint
endpoints.text: Progression-free survival (PFS) defined as the time from randomization to first documented disease progression per RECIST v1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first, as assessed by blinded independent central review (BICR).

objectives.name: OBJ_OS
objectives.label: Secondary OS Objective
objectives.text: To compare the overall survival (OS) of Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy versus placebo in combination with standard of care chemotherapy in subjects with advanced NSCLC.

endpoints.name: EP_OS
endpoints.label: OS Endpoint
endpoints.text: Overall survival (OS) defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause.

objectives.name: OBJ_ORR
objectives.label: Secondary ORR Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the objective response rate (ORR) of Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy versus placebo in combination with standard of care chemotherapy in subjects with advanced NSCLC.

endpoints.name: EP_ORR
endpoints.label: ORR Endpoint
endpoints.description: Objective response rate per RECIST v1.1
endpoints.text: Objective response rate (ORR) defined as the proportion of subjects with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) as best overall response per RECIST v1.1, as assessed by BICR.

objectives.name: OBJ_DOR
objectives.label: Secondary DOR Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the duration of response (DOR) of Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy versus placebo in combination with standard of care chemotherapy in subjects with advanced NSCLC.

endpoints.name: EP_DOR
endpoints.label: DOR Endpoint
endpoints.description: Duration of response per RECIST v1.1
endpoints.text: Duration of response (DOR) defined as the time from first documented CR or PR per RECIST v1.1 to first documented progression or death from any cause, as assessed by BICR.

objectives.name: OBJ_BIOMARKER
objectives.label: Exploratory Biomarker Objective
objectives.text: To explore the association between potential predictive biomarkers (including PD-L1 expression, tumor mutational burden, and circulating tumor DNA) and clinical outcomes in subjects treated with Compound-X in combination with standard of care chemotherapy.

endpoints.name: EP_BIOMARKER
endpoints.label: Biomarker Endpoint
endpoints.text: Correlation of PD-L1 expression (tumor proportion score), tumor mutational burden (TMB), and circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) dynamics with PFS, OS, and ORR in each treatment arm.

population.name: POP_NSCLC
population.label: NSCLC Population
population.description: Adults with advanced (Stage IIIB/IV) non-small cell lung cancer

titles.text: Phase III Study of Compound-X plus SoC in Advanced NSCLC
A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Compound-X in Combination with Standard of Care Chemotherapy in Subjects with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN01_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant must be at least 18 years of age at the time of signing the informed consent.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN02_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of Stage IIIB (not amenable to curative therapy) or Stage IV non-small cell lung cancer (squamous or non-squamous histology).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN03_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: At least one measurable lesion per RECIST v1.1 criteria. Previously irradiated lesions are acceptable as target lesions only if there is documented progression of the lesion after irradiation.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN04_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN05_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Adequate organ function as defined by: absolute neutrophil count >= 1500/uL, platelets >= 100,000/uL, hemoglobin >= 9.0 g/dL, serum creatinine <= 1.5x ULN or creatinine clearance >= 50 mL/min, total bilirubin <= 1.5x ULN, AST and ALT <= 2.5x ULN (or <= 5x ULN for subjects with liver metastases).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX01_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior systemic chemotherapy for advanced/metastatic NSCLC. Subjects who received adjuvant or neoadjuvant platinum-based chemotherapy and developed recurrence more than 6 months after completion are eligible.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX02_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active or untreated central nervous system (CNS) metastases. Subjects with treated brain metastases that are clinically stable for at least 2 weeks and without requirement for systemic corticosteroids are eligible.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX03_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunosuppressive treatment within the past 2 years. Subjects with vitiligo, type 1 diabetes mellitus, hypothyroidism requiring only hormone replacement, or conditions not expected to recur are permitted.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX04_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior treatment with any anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4, or any other immunotherapy agent targeting immune checkpoint pathways.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX05_ITEM
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known EGFR sensitizing mutation or ALK translocation. Subjects with these genomic alterations should be directed to appropriate targeted therapy.

legalAddress.text: 100 Research Boulevard, Cambridge, MA, 02142, United States of America
8600 Rockville Pike, Bethesda, MD, 20894, United States of America

studyInterventions.name: Compound-X
studyInterventions.label: Compound-X
studyInterventions.description: Compound-X, investigational agent, administered intravenously every 3 weeks in combination with standard of care chemotherapy

studyInterventions.name: Placebo
studyInterventions.label: Placebo
studyInterventions.description: Matching placebo for Compound-X, administered intravenously every 3 weeks

studyInterventions.name: SoC Chemotherapy
studyInterventions.label: Standard of Care Chemotherapy
studyInterventions.description: Investigator choice of platinum-based doublet chemotherapy (carboplatin/pemetrexed for non-squamous or carboplatin/paclitaxel for squamous histology)

administrations.name: SOC_CHEMO_Q3W
administrations.label: SoC Chemo IV Q3W
administrations.description: Standard of care platinum-based doublet chemotherapy IV every 3 weeks for 4-6 cycles

duration.reasonDurationWillVary: Duration varies by chemotherapy regimen per institutional practice
